flashcards.notes: The particle 'No' modifies words and phrases in multiple ways - changes meaning drastically. Compare: mûhaka (boundary) vs No mûhaka (it is a must)
examples: No mûhaka (It is a must) - without NO: mûhaka = boundary
No kwarî na maûndû (There were still issues)
No nguo yake yarî ndaihu (But her dress was long)
Korwo no ûrîrîkane (If you could remember)
Ûria mendaga no kwona nyina wao (They only wanted to see their mother)

flashcards.notes: Using 'No' with present tense verbs to indicate continuation - 'you are still...'
examples: No rwimbo? (You are still listening to music?)
No ndore úraringa? (You are still jumping?)
